content:
Add Conditional Styles to a FlexCard Element

Conditionally apply styles to a FlexCard element. Change style features such as text color, background image, and responsiveness when a condition based on the value of a data field is met.

To add a conditional style:

1. Select an element in your FlexCard.
2. Click + Add Conditional Style from the Style panel.
3. Enter a unique name for the visible label for your conditional style.
4. Click + Add Condition to configure conditions based on the value of a data field.
5. Click Save.

A Default section is added to the top of the Style panel. When conditions aren't met, the default styles apply.

You can also:

* Hover over the tooltip "i" icon next to the conditional style name to see which conditions are applied.
* Edit a conditional style by clicking its pencil () icon.
* Switch between how your element looks when conditions are applied and not applied by selecting the conditional style's toggle button ().
* Delete a conditional style by clicking its trash () icon.

FlexCards Conditional Style Properties can be configured from the Style panel in the FlexCard Designer.
title: Adding Conditional Styles in OmniStudio
